intro: Ternstroemia dentata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves with serrated margins and produces small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
